cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles ESE of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to slow and then curve northwest across the Leeward Islands, then track toward Puerto Rico and the northeast Caribbean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Leeward Islands (near Dominica) Monday night, then a direct passage over or very near Puerto Rico on Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Antigua, Barbuda, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Guadeloupe, Saba, St. Eustatius, St. Maarten, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Anguilla; Tropical Storm Watch for Martinique, Barbados, St. Vincent & the Grenadines
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Dominica; Tropical Storm Warning for St. Lucia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and northern Windward Islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) are likely by early Wednesday with a 48% peak onset probability; risk of hurricane-force winds (50 kt cumulative 54%, 64 kt cumulative 34%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft possible along the north and east coasts of Puerto Rico, depending on exact track and intensity at landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash floods and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive surf, rip currents, and possible port-channel shoaling from wave scour.
